Description: Round-topped sandstone stela divided into three registers: 1 - Central offering-table flanked on the left by the seated figures of Amenhotep III and Queen Tiy and on the right by Osiris(enthroned) and Isis. 2 - Scene of a row of male and female figures, the frontmost pouring a libation before a seated male and female couple. 3 - Five rows of Hieroglyphic text including the cartouches of Amenhotep III.
Curator's comments: Published: C. Zeigler, in Fs. Leclant, 1993, Vol 1, p. 535. S. Walker and M. Bierbrier, Fayum. Misteriosi volti dall'Egitto, London 1997, p. 44 [9]. HTBM Part 7: Plate XXI
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1997 22 Oct-1998 30 Apr, Italy, Rome, Fondaione Memmo, Ancient Faces
Associated names: Named in inscription & portrayed: Amenhotep III
